page.title: 16CATTLE AND GOATS, RHUM
page.content:
There are about 40 Highland Cattle on Rhum. They are fed only in the winter. In the summer they graze. Calves are born at the end of March and right through April. The Cattle are sometimes brought in to the village for the vet to examine or else he goes out to see them. Only the best Cattle are sold; the Spanish John usually comes over for them and they are sold in Fort William in the Cattle market.
There are about 150-200 feral Goats on Rhum which graze the whole year round in the mountains. They also scavenge the beach amongst the seaweed. This year (1985) some research and surveying of these animals is being carried out.
